Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, Been such a long time since I posted on here but, I do still pop on and read some posts. So it's been 13 months since my last chemo in December 2016, and a bit less time for the rads which finished in February 2017.  Had my first mammogram in July 2017 got the all clear and I thought, everything was getting back to normal.   Then the chest infections came :(  the first one lasted 4 weeks and with lots of antibiotics did go.   Only to return about 5 weeks later in November 2017.  Breathless and constantly coughing up tons of nasty stuff, feeling so tired all I want to do is sleep.  After 3 visits to the doctor in which time I had a one week course of antibiotics, and steroids which didn't help I eventually got lucky and saw a different doctor.  He did a really thorough job in listening and tapping my chest unlike the other one.  He said my left lung sounded different. So tomorrow I go for a chest x-ray and he has marked it urgent so should get the result on Thurs or Friday coming.  So now I am thinking.....what if I have lung cancer?   My thoughts are all doom and gloom at the moment.  Only my husband and eldest daughter know as my other daughter would be in bits if I told her.  Will wait and see what the actual results say.  What if the results are ok?  Do I ask for a CT scan?  Or just leave it and hope these new antibiotics I now have for 2 weeks will do the job?  I also have tonsillitis at the moment too, so feel really sorry for myself :(      I had hoped I would get to see my 2 little grand daughters grow up, now?  Sorry, can't vent to anyone else as they really wouldn't understand how I feel at the moment.  Like they say, you have to have been there to understand. Gillian
Posts.Title: Possible lung cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you Sal x  Trying to stay positive.  Roll on Friday!
Posts.Title: Possible lung cancer

Posts.Content: Thanks Gilly :)  So much positivity from everyone.  Feel bad keeping this from my youngest but, it would break her.  Feeling like I am being a bit silly I guess now.  Roll on Friday.....I am ready for you now!
Posts.Title: Possible lung cancer

Posts.Content: Thanks Sue!  With such positivity from you I feel better already :)
Posts.Title: Possible lung cancer

Posts.Content: Hi JackiRuss, All the ladies have given you some really great advice.  Just had my first chemo and felt rough for 5/6 days.  Heaps better now :)  I have been off work since I had my lumpectomy, so almost 8 wks now.  I work in the public service industry (bus driver lol) so was advised not to go back to work until it was all done with.  My boss has been brilliant!  The firm I work for allows 40 wks full pay, so a worry off of my mind.  So do as the ladies say and take care of yourself.  Easier said than done sometimes I know.  I really hope you feel better soon. Gillian x
Posts.Title: First chemo was on 17th August

Posts.Content: Hi Laura, I was really scared about having the Docetaxel treatment.  I asked if I could have a reduction in the dosage and if a reduction would render the treatment any less effective.  I was told I could have a 25% reduction and no it wouldn't be any less effective :)  My first dose was a nightmare to be honest but, the really bad side effects only lasted about 3/4 days.  Then it was bearable for the rest of the time. The 2nd and 3rd dose were nowhere near as bad as the first though, so I guess it's true that your body does get used to it. You are a wonderful girl, taking time out of uni to look after your mum.  I am sure she really appreciates your help.  Take care xxx
Posts.Title: Mum starts Docetaxel soon for stage 3 breast cancer. Any advice ladies...

Posts.Content: Hi Hannah, I started losing skin after dose13 of radiotherapy.  So after number 20 it was well advanced!  I saw a nurse today and she gave me some numbing gel to put on first then put the intrasite on top of it.  So I have been  sore for 10 days now.  And if as you say it peaks after 10 days then I still have another 7 days of pain to look forward to :(  oh well in a months time it will be a distant memory I hope. xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy burns & blisters

Posts.Content: Hi MoMo2626, Thanks for the tip about washing.  I do shower every day, although I try not to have the shower hit that breast but it does sometimes I guess. The op and node removal scars are very painful at the moment.  Turning into a recluse now as was told not to wear my bra, and being so big I don't feel comfortable going out with them swinging lol.  Will give it another few days then will go back to the doctor as it should be starting to heal after 7 days shouldn't it?  Glad you didn't suffer as bad x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy burns & blisters

Posts.Content: Hi Hannah, I started losing skin after dose13 of radiotherapy.  So after number 20 it was well advanced!  I saw a nurse today and she gave me some numbing gel to put on first then put the intrasite on top of it.  So I have been  sore for 10 days now.  And if as you say it peaks after 10 days then I still have another 7 days of pain to look forward to :(  oh well in a months time it will be a distant memory I hope. xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy burns & blisters

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, I finished my 20 days of Radiotherapy a couple of days ago.  Being rather large busted I have burnt quite badly. Blisters also starting to pop up :(  I was given Intrasite gel and melalin dressings.  I also air under my breast for a few hours each day and am not wearing my bra around the house.  Another lady mentioned Flamazime cream at the hospital.  Has anyone used it?  Can you use it on the burns? How long will it take to heal under my breast as the pain is really awful at the moment.  No pus or anything, just bright pink with the burnt bits still coming away when I wash it.  Any help from anyone who has been through this would really be appreciated.  Thanks x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy burns & blisters

Posts.Content: Hi MoMo2626, Thanks for the tip about washing.  I do shower every day, although I try not to have the shower hit that breast but it does sometimes I guess. Posts.Title: Radiotherapy burns & blisters

Posts.Content: Hi, I bought some R1 & R2 cream but got it after already had 11 doses of radiotherapy.  So I guess I got it too late to stop the burns and blistering.  Seems everything does boil down to money though. x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy burns & blisters

Posts.Content: Hi Lindylou49, Yes, have some of them for night time.  I find the awful stinging, burning pain by my scars the worst now.  Like biting fire ants.....not that I have ever been bitten by them lol.  Thanks for the hugs x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy burns & blisters

Posts.Content: Hi, I bought some R1 & R2 cream but got it after already had 11 doses of radiotherapy.  So I guess I got it too late to stop the burns and blistering.  Seems everything does boil down to money though. x

Posts.Title: Radiotherapy burns & blisters

Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca Just to say that I totally agree with you X
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Good Morning Amy66, Thanks for your words.  I spent last night huddled up with my beloved dog.  Seems she is the only one that really understands me at the moment.  Every part of my being screamed NO the last time I went to chemo.  It felt so very wrong inside of me. Both my parents died in their 60s due to cancer, stomach and throat, they both smoked, I do not.  So I have always assumed I would too. Dying doesn't scare me, just the pain for others we leave behind.  I laugh and joke when at the hospital or with my family but, inside it is with me all the time. This black cloud called Cancer, like a bad smell.  When I am laughing with family, I am crying inside.  Because I know that the clock is ticking and with or without treatment we all die.  My cancer will return, just a matter of when.  All Her2 positive cancers do eventually return, unless you die from something else.  Of course I want to live, who doesn't?  But....at what price?  I have decided I would rather have 3 plus years of a great life than being miserable and not enjoying my family.  I have a 50% chance of living 5 plus years, well I will take that.  I think tonight I will finally sleep peacefully.  Thank you xxx
Posts.Title: Natural v Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Frances, I have just had the 3 Fec and am starting to feel like you. I am being poisoned and even after all this "treatment " there is still no guarantee it will never return. I am 57 and so tired of feeling ill and feel like my life is passing me by. If I was perhaps 15 years younger perhaps I would feel differently but I am not and I don't. I am only a grade 2 cancer but Her2 positive with no lymph nodes with the cancer. I had the lead nodes removed. I read that cancer cells can lay dormant for countless years so any treatment now would be totally useless.  My older sister had breast cancer 16 years ago and she is still alive. No chemo just radiotherapy. I am definitely going to talk to my onc about this and probably refuse any more treatment. This will upset my daughter but I cannot live my life suffering like I am. I probably don't have much time left anyway and want to be able to enjoy what I have left. If this is selfish, then yes I am.  Sorry if this upsets everyone else. Just how I have come to feel.
Posts.Title: Natural v Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi hi there Couldn't find the long discussion you talked about but was wondering how you are doing now. How long have you been fighting cancer now. Did it go and then return? So many questions.  Cancer never really goes, pops up again sooner or later whether you have chemo or not
Posts.Title: Natural v Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi there :) I too had white hair!  I only waited 3 months.  I did use my usual hair dye that I had previously used but, did do a test 48 hours before.  Everything was fine x
Posts.Title: Hair Colour

Posts.Content: Good Morning chloecat45 I was reading your treatment and am a bit confused, easily done lol.  Did you ever have the cancer removed surgically?  If not you have done really well with only the one source of "treatment".  Does the cancer still remain in your body?  Almost 5 yrs and still you are going strong!  Gillian x
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi Kacang Thanks for correcting me.  The nurse told it was called that so sorry for any confusion.  Took 2 goes yesterday to find a vein.  Wretched nausea though :(  got pills and my injections to do.  Hubby did the injection as my hands were shaking lol.  He was brilliant, didn't feel a thing!  Thank god for fat rolls lol. Gillian x
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Hi Nix Sorry for such a long delay in replying. Never slept so much in my life! Am taking that Liquid iron supplement with the vitamins as I read it helps you, worth trying I thought.  Sickness has now gone, whoopee! Just waiting for the mouth ulcers to start up. Am brushing every time I eat as well as using Diflan mouthwash.  My hubby does those injections in the tummy for me. Unable to do them myself lol. The one to boost the white cells. Like you say, this is the first one and I have nothing to compare it with. So hopefully I will be better able to manage the next two. Fingers crossed I get no infections.  Gillian xx
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Hi Nix I don't have any joint pain, yet she says lol. I have arthritis but no pain at the moment.  Yes, I am over keen about washing everything too. Suppose it will settle down. I do the jab in the morning as I read on here it is best too, seems to work for me. Take care, Gillian x
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone When I saw the nurse in the chemo unit she said that I already had poor veins :(  she said they can probably do my first chemo in a vein on the side of my arm but then I would have to have a portacath in the top of my arm.  I saw a lady who had one and all you can see is a small scar.  Seems they can inject, take blood etc from it.  Any down sides to having one?  I am having my first chemo on August 25th so already nervous about this let alone having the portacath!  Any help be much appreciated.  Thanks. Gillian x
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Hi Karen Thanks for taking the time to reply.  Sounds good to me then :) Gillian x
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Hi Bunty-Ann First chemo went in fine.  Wasn't until I got home when the terrible nausea kicked in :(  taking the meds and I can eat without throwing up which is something I guess.  How long does this nausea last?  Just a few days or always?  Got a mild headache too. Taken two lots of pain killers but still there.  Whether I lay down or sit up it won't go.  Drinking plenty so can't be that.  And thanks x
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah All went well just struggling with the nausea :(  how long does it go on for?  Just a few days I pray!  Drinking lots as advised.  Got a headache that just won't go.  Not really bad just there. Taken pills and no improvement sadly. Gillian xx
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Hi Penny1968 First chemo went in ok.  Only 2 goes to find a vein :)  Hubby did my injection this morning and I didn't feel a thing :)  Just this horrible nausea :(  Hope it goes soon.  And a headache :(  apart from that I am ok at the moment. Gillian x
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah, Thanks for replying.  Nice to know that there is some light at the end of this dark tunnel.  Wearing my sunglasses as I type this as light seems to make my headache worse for some reason.  I haven't actually been sick, just that nasty nausea.  Not really enjoying eating anything at the moment but I do, just cos I know have to. Love Gillian x
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Hi Carol, I am on fb lol, despite being old! Just had some French bread and broken half a tooth off. No pain as the filling is intact just the outer enamel gone. Had my teeth checked just a few weeks ago, x Ray's etc and all was well. Since it's the BH I will ring the chemo unit tomorrow and see if a temp cover or something can be attached. And try and remember to eat on the other side lol.  Trust me eh? Never been lucky in my life. Thanks for the email address.  Gillian x
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Hi Nix First chemo went ok I guess. Didn't start feeling unwell until on way home. Headache and nausea. Last night my temperature went up to 37.1. Was the same this morning. Rang the hospital and was just told to keep an eye on it as I may have a virus. How often do I need to check my temperature? Been doing it every 2/3 hours. Is this too often?  Would appreciate anyone replying. Am drinking lots and have the fan on. Gillian x
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Hi Always baking I am on FecT. Just had the first Fec. Got 3 Fec and 3 Taxotere. Then some radiotherapy. Not looking forward to the Taxotere then if you are suffering so bad.  Hope you feel better really soon. Big hugs Gillian xx
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Hello everyone :)  Had my lumpectomy done last Thursday and am just waiting for the lymph node results to see if I need them all out or not and then will start the FEC.  Have heard so much about it, some good mostly bad though!  Feeling positive at the moment, hope it lasts.  Worked up until the op day and now I am at home have noticed that people at work act like I don't exist any more :(  makes me sad and kinda mad!  I want to scream at them....."Cancer is not contagious! You can't catch it by hugging me or talking to me"  Is it just me or does everyone change towards you after your diagnosis?  They seem to avoid me like the plague now :(
Posts.Title: Hi everyone! I had my lumpectomy last week and will be starting chemo...

Posts.Content: Hi FoxySash, How long have you ben on Anastrozole?  And what side effects if any do you have?  Was give mine a few days ago and been humming and hahahing  about whether to take them or not!  Due to 99% of ladies saying their side effects are awful :(  Thanks x
Posts.Title: Bone density scan, should I have had one?
